snippet: The United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit ruled Monday that a Border Patrol agent could be sued by the family of a 15-year-old Mexican boy he shot and killed.
abstract: United States Appeals Court rules that Border Patrol agent Jesus Mesa Jr can be sued by family of 15-year-old Mexican boy he shot and killed over the Mexican border; says agent's conduct is unlawful, therefore he does not qualify for constitutional protections.
lead_paragraph: The United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit ruled Monday that a Border Patrol agent could be sued by the family of a 15-year-old Mexican boy he shot and killed.

headline.main: Texas: Panel Rules Agent Can Be Sued Over Shooting Teenager Across Border
headline.print_headline: Texas: Panel Rules Agent Can Be Sued Over Shooting Teenager Across Border
